title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.3: Early Child Development (ECD)

description.narrative: Output 2.4 Every Child learns: LAC COs have increased capacity to develop, implement and deliver results for every child to access Early Child Development (ECD) and education opportunities and learn, including in emergencies, fragile and humanitarian contexts., which contributes to Children With Disabilities, Early Childhood Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: OUTCOME 2 EVERY CHILD LEARNS : Girls and boys and adolescents in LAC benefit from equitable, inclusive and relevant Early Child Development (ECD) and education programmes and policies, fostering their full development in the early years, on-time enrollment, transitions, and completion as well as their learning and skills development.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.4 Every Child learns: LAC COs have increased capacity to develop, implement and deliver results for every child toaccess ECD and education opportunities and learn, including in emergencies, fragile and humanitarian contexts.

description.narrative: To address the developmental needs of LAC children and support COVID-19 response and recovery UNICEF continued its efforts toi) Support the creation of enabling environmentto reach families with enhanced quality services, across sectors, through multisectoral programming, national policies, budgeted action plans and coordinated and accountable management frameworks supporting multisectoral interventions, ii) Support ECD workforce across sectors and platformsto be adequately trained, equipped and supported to deliver interventions that foster healthy and safe child development and caregiver well-being, iii) Strengthen Parents’ and Caregivers’ parenting skillsin essential aspects of positive parenting,; breastfeeding, early learning, playful interactions, co-responsibility.; | Status:Met | As-of Date:03/03/2022

title.narrative: Number of countries with inter-sectoral and inter-agency coordination mechanisms to promote policies and mechanisms of rapid responses to guarantee ECD services for children affected by emergencies, fragile and humanitarian contexts, with UNICEF support(69211)

Number of countries improving integrated ECD policies and programmes and scale up action plans based on an essential package of services based on national or international standards, with UNICEF support(69210)
